headline: Is Boeing Stock Going to $204? 1 Wall Street Analyst Thinks So.
summary: Boeing (NYSE: BA) is quietly having a good run.  In addition, Melius Research had some good news for investors when one of its analysts upgraded the stock to buy and slapped a $204 price target on the stock.  As previously discussed, there's a healthy bull and bear debate around Boeing stock, and Melius Research has come down on the bullish side, citing confidence in relatively new CEO Kelly Ortberg's turnaround plans.

headline: Airbus getting better at managing supply chain disruptions, senior executive says
summary: Disruptions to the supply chain that are delaying aircraft deliveries are lessening and Airbus is getting much better at managing it, a senior company executive said on Monday.  The European planemaker, which delivered 766 jets last year, roughly in line with its target, has been facing industrial delays due partly to problems in the aerospace supply chain, which have also hampered the recovery of embattled U.S. rival Boeing.  Speaking to reporters in Taiwan, Airbus commercial aircraft executive vice president of sales Benoit de Saint-Exupery said it is taking a long time for the supply chain to get back on track, with a lot of disruptions in many suppliers.

raw.headline: Airbus getting better at managing supply chain disruptions, senior executive says
raw.summary: Disruptions to the supply chain that are delaying aircraft deliveries are lessening and Airbus is getting much better at managing it, a senior company executive said on Monday. Speaking to reporters in Taiwan, Airbus commercial aircraft executive vice president of sales Benoit de Saint-Exupery said it is taking a long time for the supply chain to get back on track, with a lot of disruptions in many suppliers.

summary: Boeing [NYSE: BA] and BOC Aviation have announced a new, firm order for 50 737-8 jets, expanding the lessor's 737 MAX portfolio to 215 737-8s and 737-9s.

headline: BOC Aviation to buy 120 Boeing, Airbus aircraft in fleet expansion push
summary: BOC Aviation, majority-owned by the Bank of China, will buy 70 A320NEO family aircraft from Airbus and 50 737-8 jets from Boeing.  The deal underscores the increasing demand for narrowbody aircraft as global travel surges, though production challenges, including workers' strike, regulatory scrutiny, and supply pressures, threaten to cause delivery delays.  Boeing and BOC Aviation did not disclose the details of the deal, while Airbus did not immediately respond to a Reuters request for comment.

raw.headline: BOC Aviation to buy 120 Boeing, Airbus aircraft in fleet expansion push

The deal underscores the increasing demand for narrowbody aircraft as global travel surges, though production challenges, including workers' strike, regulatory scrutiny, and supply pressures, threaten to cause delivery delays.  Boeing and BOC Aviation did not disclose the details of the deal, while Airbus did not immediately respond to a Reuters request for comment.
